column4: Could some one please tell me how to I reinstall the nvidia drivers . It was working fine till i recompiled my Kernel to .6.21
try sudo depmod -a
is there a newer driver for the .21
depmod -a gives no output
how do I recompile it with the new kernel ?
will look up the nvidia page
i am downloading the driver as we speek
it contains a script with either a graphical and a text based menu
lspci | grep Audio tells me that i have a nVidia Cprp. MCP51 High Definiation Audio >> Though i cant get the sound to work
i currently have this module for the sound card loaded
yea I was telling ya abt the hardware I have . Any idea how i could get it working
I have no clue
try "sudo modprobe nvsound"
if it does not work, there is another: "sudo modprobe intel8x0"
nvsound is not a module
maybe it is "sudo modprobe snd_intel8x0"
have a look at http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2622017 check the post by farbird on the 9th of may
did modprobe find the intel module?
type "cp /dev/urandom /dev/dsp" you should hear noise, if you got sound working
if you want to test it further, there is a command line mp3 player named mpg321
hmm. maybe it uses another driver. at least /dev/dsp works
kitche , i just got the nvdia video driver downloaded , will have to pull it off my desk top
what error?
